events.message: The policyholder reported an auto accident involving their vehicle and another car at an intersection. The claim was officially filed with all initial details.
After reviewing the submitted documents, the claim was categorized under Auto Accident per the keywords related to vehicle collision.
An experienced claims agent was assigned promptly to handle the customer's auto accident claim and guide them through the process.
The claim acknowledgment notice was sent to the customer confirming receipt and outlining the upcoming steps needed for processing.
A request was made for additional documentation, including the police report and photos of the damaged vehicle to proceed with the investigation.
The customer submitted all requested documents in a timely manner, including scanned copies of the accident report and repair estimates.
The investigation into the claim was initiated to verify the details of the collision, damages sustained, and assess liability factors.
The investigation concluded successfully confirming the validity of the claim and establishing the extent of damage to the vehicle.
A settlement amount was proposed to the policyholder based on repair shop estimates and the terms of the insurance policy.
The customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the service provided so far.
Final approval for the claim was granted following customer acceptance of the proposed reimbursement amount.
Payment was successfully issued to the customerâ€™s designated bank account for the agreed settlement of the auto accident claim.
The claim case was officially closed with all necessary payments made and documentation finalized for the auto accident incident.
The claim files and all related documents were archived in the system to maintain records for future reference and compliance.
